definition: ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine
to freeze/to feel very cold/aspic or jelly
three feet of ice does not form in a single day (idiom); Rome wasn't built in a day
pinyin: bing1 dong4 san1 chi3 , fei1 yi1 ri4 zhi1 han2

sentences.english: Still water and still religion freeze the quickest.
sentences.chinese: 一潭死水和死寂的宗教冰冻得最快。

sentences.english: Natasha's voice rang out in the frost -bound air.
sentences.chinese: 在冰冻天气的冷空气中传来娜塔莎的说话声。

sentences.english: I know, Rome was not built in a day.
sentences.chinese: 我知道，冰冻三尺非一日之寒。

sentences.english: Round and round the frozen lake the children skated.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在冰冻的湖面上滑来滑去。

sentences.english: Such as really keep aggravation in deep freeze, won't rule out the probability of sealing the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 如确实冰冻严重，将不排除封山的可能性。

sentences.english: Where the snow is like a cold wind plum, frozen ice core incense, but also lonely and also Yan.
sentences.chinese: 凡雪，冰冻冰芯香，但也孤独，也严梅像寒风中。

sentences.english: By the 16th century, skaters were transporting goods across frozen waterways.
sentences.chinese: 16世纪的溜冰者是在冰冻的水面上运送货物。

sentences.english: Our feet crunched on the frozen snow.
sentences.chinese: 我们的双脚嘎吱作响地“踩”着冰冻的雪地。

sentences.english: While he was gone, the oxen pulled the wagon, with the family inside, through a frozen stream.
sentences.chinese: 它没在那时，牛正拉着车里的一家人穿过冰冻的河面。

sentences.english: So what were heat-loving organisms doing in the freezingsediment of the Arctic?
sentences.chinese: 那么，北极冰冻的沉积物中的喜温生物都做些什么呢？

sentences.english: Characteristics of sea ice floe size distribution in the seasonal ice zone.
sentences.chinese: 在季节性冰冻地带海冰浮冰块大小分布的特性。

sentences.english: Stepmother should have fresh fish, the weather is cold freezing, nowhere is bought.
sentences.chinese: 继母要吃鲜鱼，天寒冰冻，无处购买。

sentences.english: The frozen Dark Jedi lured Aayla to his tomb, and had her deactivate the stasis shield.
sentences.chinese: 被冰冻的黑暗绝地引诱她进入坟墓，打开了封印罩。

sentences.english: Only an act of true love can thaw a frozen heart.
sentences.chinese: 唯有真爱才能够融化冰冻的心。

sentences.english: The weatherman warned us that the roads were icy.
sentences.chinese: 气象员告诫我们说路面有冰冻。

sentences.english: Sherbet is made with fruits and ice.
sentences.chinese: 冰冻果子露是用水果和冰做的。

definition: to freeze over/to ice over/icebound/to shelve (a proposal etc)
ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine
to freeze/to feel very cold/aspic or jelly
to freeze over (of water or land)
cold air current/cold ocean current/cold stream
